title: Psychology of Addictions - Behavioral Addictions
banerDescription: Explore the psychological aspects of behavioral addictions and learn effective therapy methods and support for individuals with these problems.

description2: The postgraduate studies in "Behavioral Addictions" aim to prepare students to work with individuals addicted to activities such as gambling, computer games, sex, shopping, eating, and others. The program combines theoretical knowledge with intensive clinical practice, enabling students to acquire the competencies necessary for effective therapeutic work.
scheduleInfo: The third semester is dedicated to internships

faculty: The program will be conducted by a qualified team of specialists in the fields of psychology, psychiatry, addiction therapy, and other related disciplines. The faculty will include both academic lecturers and practitioners with many years of clinical experience.
practices:
• 50% - possibility to complete internships remotely at the MAGNOLIA Psychological and Pedagogical Counseling Center
  • The remaining 50% can be completed:
    • in home institutions in the form of additional classes or performed within the teaching load,
    • in educational institutions,
    • in counseling centers,
    • other.
evaluation: The assessment of learning outcomes will be based on: preparation of a project work in the area of Psychology of Addictions - Behavioral Addictions.
jobOpportunities: Graduates of the "Behavioral Addictions" program will be prepared to work in various therapeutic institutions, such as addiction treatment centers, mental health clinics, psychiatric hospitals, as well as in non-governmental organizations dealing with addiction prevention and therapy.
